Key Match Events: Andy Ibáñez hit a tiebreaking three-run double in Detroit’s four-run eighth inning.
Parker Meadows homered as Detroit ended Houston’s run of seven consecutive appearances in the AL Championship Series.
Kerry Carpenter sparked Detroit’s eighth-inning rally with a one-out single off Ryan Pressly.
Sean Guenther pitched 1 2/3 innings for the win in Game 2, and Will Vest handled the ninth for the save.
Detroit used seven different pitchers a day after pitching Triple Crown winner Tarik Skubal got the win in the series opener.
Post-Match Reflections: It was a sweet moment for Tigers manager A.J. Hinch, who led Houston to a championship in 2017 and was fired in the aftermath of the Astros’ sign-stealing scandal.
Just making it to the playoffs seemed improbable before Detroit went 31-13 down the stretch in the regular season, helped along by the leadership of Hinch.
The Astros jumped in front in the seventh, but they lost their seventh straight postseason game at home.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eight of the first nine Wild Card Series since they began in 2002 have been sweeps.
It’s the fourth sweep in postseason history for the Tigers, who previously swept the AL Championship Series in 1984, 2006 and 2012.
Houston’s ALCS streak included four World Series appearances and two titles.
